summary: REQ-1 appears partially implemented (new calibrated thresholds and eye-state classification added), but the diff is truncated before showing the actual blink-counting transition logic, so full compliance with the transition/guard acceptance criteria can’t be confirmed from the provided evidence. REQ-2 can’t be confirmed because the relevant copy changes in DeviceConnection.tsx are truncated. Additional unrelated files (project_state.json, frontend-file-summaries.txt) were modified without being requested.

missing_requirements.requirement: A blink is counted when the sensor reading transitions from the open state into the closed state, with a guard preventing multiple counts during a single closure; staying in open counts none; staying in closed counts at most one until returning to open.
missing_requirements.reason: BluetoothContext.tsx shows new thresholds and an eye-state classifier, but the diff is truncated before the code that increments blink count / records timestamps, so the required open→closed transition counting and guard behavior is not verifiable from the provided diff summary.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update the "Raw Sensor Reading (Debug)" description and Help section note in DeviceConnection.tsx to remove references to "drops below 30" and describe the calibrated open/closed light-level thresholds in English, without unrelated UI text changes.
missing_requirements.reason: DeviceConnection.tsx is truncated before the debug/help copy sections, so it’s not possible to confirm the specific text was updated and that no unrelated UI text was changed.

hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asks for frontend blink detection logic and UI copy updates; no requirement mentions updating project_state.json.
Not requested by REQ-1 or REQ-2; appears to be ancillary documentation/state output rather than implementing the specified threshold/copy changes.
